intro: Thlaspi stenocarpum, commonly known as narrow-seeded cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustard. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Thlaspi stenocarpum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
